topic.title: How to Start Oxygen Feedback as a Linux Service

ol.li: Log in to the machine as a root user.

Edit the feedback.service file and update the value for ExecStart, WorkingDirectory, and user properties (e.g. via vim, vi, or gedit):Replace the <installation_directory> with the installation directory path of the Oxygen Feedback application. For example: /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback.[Unit] Description=Oxygen Feedback After=syslog.target
[Service] User=user Type=exec PIDFile=<installation_directory>/pid.file # The path to the oxygen-feedback scripts. ExecStart=<installation_directory>/bin/start.sh ExecStop=<installation_directory>/bin/stop.sh WorkingDirectory=<installation_directory> SuccessExitStatus=143
[Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target

Copy the feedback.service.template file to the /etc/systemd/system/oxygen-feedback.service file and give the permissions:cp ./feedback.service.template /etc/systemd/system/oxygen-feedback.service chmod 644 /etc/systemd/system/oxygen-feedback.service
Enable the service and start it:systemctl daemon-reload systemctl enable oxygen-feedback.service systemctl start oxygen-feedback.service systemctl status oxygen-feedback.service

body.p: Pass additional arguments using the feedback.conf file from installation folder via:

ul.li: RUN_ARGS - The arguments to pass to the program (e.g: -Dserver.port=9999).
JAVA_OPTS - Options that are passed to the JVM when it is launched.
JAVA_HOME - The location of the java executable is discovered by using the PATH by default, but you can set it explicitly if there is an executable file at $JAVA_HOME/bin/java.

body.note: If you need to edit the /etc/systemd/system/oxygen-feedback.service file afterward, you must run:systemctl daemon-reload
